revised_title: Chemical Variation in Galium Species: Anthraquinone Pigments
tldr: This study investigates the occurrence of chemical variations in the plant genus Galium, focusing on the anthraquinone pigments found in its species. The researchers discovered that the pigment alizarin varies significantly in amount across different species and strains, while purpurin-3-carboxylic acid is consistently present in the roots of Galium species. The findings suggest the potential for using chemical differences to create strains with distinct characteristics.
